Description: • Polished black-topped brown ware pottery jar with rounded base and in-drawn wall; repaired in antiquity with 11 drilled holes flanking cracks on the upper body.
Curator's comments: Brunton’s Black-topped brown BB77k. Published: A.J. Spencer, Early Egypt, London (1993), fig. 11
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (p.5; pls/ xiii.BB77k; xx.12)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
